items.sentence: Why do things like this keep happening to me?
Why do things like this keep happening to us?
I\'ve always enjoyed playing tennis with Tom.
What\'ll happen to Tom if he\'s found guilty?
She\'d like him to come to her house at 2:30.
I still don\'t have enough money to buy that.
I still haven\'t forgiven Tom for doing that.
Tom pretended that he didn\'t recognize Mary.
Tom has trouble coping with people like Mary.
Tom hid the money he got from Mary in a book.
My father is busy getting ready for his trip.
There\'s an antique clock in the living room.
When was the last time you ate a pomegranate?
Where did you get that scratch on your cheek?
Why aren\'t you doing what I asked you to do?
You\'re a professional musician, aren\'t you?
Mary was the only girl Tom ever really loved.
Mary was the only girl Tom was interested in.
When was the last time you were really happy?
When was the last time your changed your oil?
Where are you planning on going this evening?
Where can I find a good financial consultant?
Tom used to be a pretty good baseball player.
Tom used to work in an office on Park Street.
Tom isn\'t likely be punished for doing that.
Tom isn\'t likely to be as busy as you think.
Tom doesn\'t seem to be aware of the problem.
I\'m eating dinner now. Can I call you later?
I never want to eat at this restaurant again.
I prefer to sit in the back of the classroom.
Please turn off the radio and turn on the TV.
I\'ve always wanted to travel through Europe.
I\'ve asked you several times not to do that.
I\'ve been hired to take care of the problem.
I hope Tom remembers how to get to our house.
Tom would be furious if he knew what you did.
Tom will be Mary\'s French teacher next year.
Where will you be going next summer vacation?
Where would you like me to put your suitcase?
Tom committed suicide by jumping off a cliff.
Tom cooks chicken just the way Mary likes it.
Tom could see someone standing near the gate.
Tom said he didn\'t know where Mary had gone.
Tom said he didn\'t want to travel with Mary.
The broken leg isn\'t Tom\'s biggest problem.
Do you care what other people think about us?
Tom started getting impatient and frustrated.
Tom started to come in, but Mary stopped him.
Tom stopped smiling and gave me a dirty look.
Tom struggled to keep up with his classmates.
